bibl.title: Philadelphus' Procession: Dynastic Power in a Mediterranean Context.
Politics, Administration and Society in the Hellenistic and Roman World. Proceedings of the International Colloquium, Bertinoro 19-24 July 1997
bibl.author: THOMPSON, Dorothy J.

bibl.note: Evaluates the royal festival in honour of the first Ptolemy in its particular point of time and place. Tries to identify the role it was meant to play and to assess how far it succeeded in that role. - Pp. 381-388: Appendix. The Date of the Ptolemaieia described by [Kallixeinos of Rhodes and excerpted in] Athenaeus [probably 279-278 B.C.].
THOMPSON Dorothy J., Philadelphus' Procession: Dynastic Power in a Mediterranean Context.

Leon MOOREN (Ed.), Politics, Administration and Society in the Hellenistic and Roman World. Proceedings of the International Colloquium, Bertinoro 19-24 July 1997 = Studia Hellenistica. 36 (Leuven, 2000) pp. 365-388.
